snippet: In Supreme Court arguments Wednesday on the fate of the health care law, Chief Justice John G. Roberts Jr. traded his usual display of intellect and competitiveness for a sphinxlike demeanor.
abstract: Chief Justice John G Roberts Jr, whose vote could be decisive in Supreme Court case deciding fate of federal subsidies under Affordable Care Act, asks only handful of questions in tense hearing; sphinxlike demeanor gives little indication of whether he will again support the law, as he did in 2012.
lead_paragraph: In Supreme Court arguments Wednesday on the fate of the health care law, Chief Justice John G. Roberts Jr. traded his usual display of intellect and competitiveness for a sphinxlike demeanor.

headline.main: With Eyes on His Vote in Health Subsidies Case, Roberts Lets on Little
headline.print_headline: With Eyes on His Vote in Health Subsidies Case, Roberts Lets On Little

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
